name: Adrian
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
comment: PLEEEEEASE people, stop complaining about the display and things like that, the display is just AMAZING!!By looking at the low rating of the item, I was really impatient to recieve my device and finally write the review about it. I pre-ordered the S24 Ultra in Violet color, 512Gb version, and want to note that everything was fair as expected - I got the 512Gb version at the price of 256Gb one, and also 200$ Amazon Gift, which is a non-redeemable gift that works as a single time -200$ to your purchases FROM AMAZON, that you can use within approximately 5 or 6 months.Next about the device - it's really beautiful! I really love everything about it, the size, the flat screen, the back cover and cameras - design-wise this is a beauty.It has lot's of nice and fun features to play with, it's my second day of usage and I still have AI features to test, camera capabilities to check out, etc. And the S Pen - this is my first ever Samsung phone, and I really got used to it, and to be honest - it's sometimes a lot more comfortable to use the S Pen instead of your fingers. Some things in life are really designed to be accomplished with a pen and paper, this phone covers that need!The sound and speakers are veeery loud, I mean my whole office can hear my incoming notifications lol, and the quality of music listening, video watching, etc. - really nice.I still have to find out all of the capabilities of the camera, this is a separate big topic, but so far I can confirm what lot's of reviewers have already talked about - the normal photo taking is great, selfies look really amazing for a front camera, the zoom is fantastic with really good details, night mode results in bright as day photos (although a bit noisy) and video shooting is also nice with different mods.The OS is very nice and really sophisticated to say the least, I mean you can connect the device to a monitor, mouse and keyboard via some 5-in-1 Anker for example, and here you just got yourself a laptop with the size of a phone. OneUI is really the most rich software I've used so far, and before using it I was skeptical if I'd like it or not, but I'm really getting used to it, and the features like multitasking in a true desktop way on the phone - this is something else (not the Dex, just phone multi window usage, that's AWESOME).The battery is nice, maybe I expected something more by viewing some reviews with almost 20 hours of screen time or so, but really it's fine for a day of usage with QHD resolution, adaptive brightness, and app and AI usage during the whole day.The only disadvantages I want to mention are the price tag that is high (let's be honest) and the box contents, I mean why copy bad stuff from Apple and not include at least a small charging brick in the box? This is really uncool, especially within that price.I started with the display, but want to finish talking about it as well, it's HUGE, and I really like it, the corners are sharp-ended, but that gives you the advantage of viewing a non-cropped-out content, the resolution, the brightness, refresh rate... The display is a killer really, I really don't get the people that complain about the color, or perform some tests on the device, etc.... no need.Overall I'm really happy with my purchase, this is a great phone I can recommend to any software and hardware enthusiasts like me, and maybe to iPhone users as well, to come out of the box and see that there are other great phones out there in the world that can totally kill any iPhone with all the features and stuff you get.

name: Marc
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
comment: I've been using my Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra for a couple of days now and while it's a decent phone, it has its issues. The screen is washed out like they say, but that might be resolved in an OS update. Mine has a grainy screen like the rest of Galaxy S24 Ultra owners have been complaining about, so that's one reason to wait before preordering the next Galaxy smartphone. I didn't see the banding issue and I don't believe I have the camera issue, but I haven't played much with the camera to tell. If you're upgrading from the S23U, might be best to keep it and wait another year.Besides the phone itself, I've been super frustrated from my experience preordering from Amazon.The preorder page had a deal where you'd get the 512GB storage upgrade + $200 Amazon gift card sent via email after the phone was delivered. I got the storage upgrade, but I never received the $200 Amazon gift card they promised. Why I think this is a scam is that Amazon switched the preorder deal with the launch deal on the Amazon order page, so now when you ask Amazon Support about it, they can't help because the info is no longer on the Amazon site. Getting to this conclusion was a waste of time because I've spent hours talking to multiple Amazon employees (all useless & with different answers) and never received a reply from the email I received from their Care team showing proof of the many popular news outlets advertising the pre order deal (Google CNET, Phone Arena, ZDNET, The Verge, CBS News, Digital Trends, etc and you can find them talking about the preorder deal on Amazon for the phone).So yea, don't preorder because Amazon doesn't honor their end on deals and you might get a faulty phone that's not covered in influencer reviews (wait for the real reviews from real customers)

name: Kristian Sordo
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
comment: The phone lives up to its hype, not much more to add. Haven't played around with its AI features yet. Photography is superb! The screen colors are a bit dull, but that's a moot point since a fix will be released soon.My only gripe is with Amazon. I never received the $ 200 promotional credit advertised for pre-ordering the phone on its site. Chat support associates are clueless, stating such an offer never existed, while e-mails to customer service go unanswered. Really disappointed

name: M
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
comment: After reading the reviews, I thought I'd be returning this phone. I tend to keep my phones for about 5 years so it has to be a great one.I wasn't disappointed. Long battery. Good cameras. The front face camera is only OK. But the sound is awesome. Nice and loud. I haven't used ear buds with it yet so that's to be determined. The color of the phone it matte.The $200 credit was applied immediately. I can't see a balance on my account, but if you go to purchase something shipped by Amazon and also sold by Amazon, checkout and you will see the your credit on your total. I used the payment plan option and still received my credit after shipment.If something goes wrong with the s24 ultra, I will update:)

name: M. A.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
comment: At first I thought that it was just me, but it isn't.  It's everyone.  The world's current most expensive flagship phone actually shipped with a glitched out, awful looking  bland washed out screen that is cringe inducing when looking at it.  If you're expecting the beauty of the previous S2X phone series, you won't get it here, this screen is BAD and shipped effectively broken and not working properly to every single customer.  Honestly, everyone should be refunded and if there's a class action lawsuit, I'm definitely joining it.  All of the colors look completely washed out and almost pastel, it's just . . . BAD!  It reminds me of installing a wrong video driver in the 90's or if you're using an unsupported color/resolution mode.  Aside from the color just being horrendous and completely inaccurate, text looks smoothed and slightly blurry making it off-putting to read.  Looking at the S24 Ultra beside of the S22 Ultra is like night and day, no way in the world would I recommend someone to buy a S24 over the S22 or S23.  The S24 looks like garbage.  How in the world did they justify shipping it like this?  How in the world are they getting away with this?!  Massive respect and faith has been lost in Samsung as a smartphone leader in my eyes due to this.  Also, it's extremely suspicious that NO tech reviewers mentioned this, as if they were told not to or something.  I smell a lawsuit on the horizon . . .Shame on Samsung, big time . . .  I've been a loyal customer since the Galaxy III, but I think that this debacle has ended that long run that I was very happy about.  I feel betrayed and duped.DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE.

name: Suzi
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
comment: As a Samsung user, this got to be the BEST upgrade ever.I have the S20+ for about 4 years now and I finally decided to upgrade my phone to the S24+ and well I have nothing but POSITIVE feedbacks.Everything about this phone is a dream come true. The size is perfect and the quality is AMAZING üëè.I have been using it for at least 24hrs and it's been so good.‚úÖÔ∏è Battery‚úÖÔ∏è Photos/Pictures‚úÖÔ∏è AI Feature (one of the best)‚úÖÔ∏è Design of phone (beautiful creative)GET IT BEFORE YOU REGRET IT!!!

name: Tabatha W.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
comment: I haven't purchased a new phone in quite a while so I was pretty excited to get the latest and greatest to hold on to for the better part of the next decade.The phone seems very high quality and premium, but one problem for me.The colors on the screen do not seem to pop. They are very muted. They look almost as good as a phone I purchased almost 7 years ago. The resolution is great, but the colors, just don't seem right. Other than that I can't find anything to complain about.  I hope this is just a software issue that just needs an update or I will feel a bit ripped off for the price.

name: Michelle
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
comment: The bad:Screen is dull and low contrast regardless of settings. (This is a universally known issue at this point)The screen colors are extremely cool/blueReception is middling (still a big issue as of 2/14/24)Camera white balance is straight green/blueWide angle camera is not as wide as my Note 20 and no better qualityWhen on speakerphone, the top speaker cuts out if you put it up to your ear.Generally jagged user experience due to a bunch of Samsung crap that cannot be removed.Bloody expensive for something that's delivered in this state.The meh:Batt life is good (not great, just good) only if run in 60hz and low power mode.In low power mode at 120hz the batt life is merely acceptable.All compared to my 3ye old note 20 in low power 60hz mode which is just below acceptable.The good:The antireflective coating on the screen is genuinely amazingThe 120hz on the screen is uber smooth but unfortunately hits the battThe rest is fine; not different from my Note 20There's a thread on the Samsung forum that's thousands of posts long about these same issues I've brought up here.Hopefully all of the bad can be fixed with a software update but currently the phone is  borderline unusable due to the extremely blue camera(s) white balance and lacking signal strength. I cannot understand how after ALL THIS TIME, Samsung seemingly doesn't test their flagship phone before manufacturing and shipping.As for the cameras, they're okay if the white balance wasn't green/blue. My Note 20 from 3yrs ago takes nicer looking pictures but it's honestly difficult to tell if the cameras are any good because it's just so green/blue.I don't know what to say about all the tech reviewers out there raving about this phone. Either they were given a completely different phone or they're all paid off. I wouldn't recommend this phone to anyone until Samsung addresses the ridiculous issues.I absolutely hate Apple due to their requirement for you to live in their ecosystem but this will likely be my last Android if Samsung or someone else can't get their act together on such an expensive product.On a very very positive note, the antireflective screen on this phone is genuinely incredible. It's the single biggest upgrade imaginable. Unfortunately putting any screen protector ruins that feature so I'm just going to use it without a screen protector. The phone is worth buying simply for the antireflection. It's THAT BIG of a difference. I cannot understand why this isn't getting more attention. The darn signal strength issue is the single biggest deal breaker and so unfortunate and annoying. It's about ~20% worse than my 3yr old Note 20.

name: Knight Cat
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
comment: Specs wise it's exactly the same as the S24 ultra which is what I wanted. I'm personally not interested in all the cameras or stylus.However I'm not impressed with the 6.2 size and the iPhone-ish block looks of the body.Ironically I feel like this phone has less features than the One Plus Nord that has thumb unlock on the power button and so many UI choices not to mention the larger screen size for half the price!I also wasn't to impressed with the Samsung bloatware that can't be uninstalled unlike other unlocked phones.Over all it's an okay phone if you want something powerful and small.I just wish Samsung offered a larger sized phone without all the cameras and what not that someone like me that doesn't want or need.

name: WolvenTheWolf
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
comment: So I switched to this from a fold 3 (switched cuz of work environment) and I really like it, I've had little to no problems so farI've seen some complaints about the 150$ promotion amazon is having it does give it to u it doesn't apply it to ur account like a gift card tho, u have to buy something made and shipped from Amazon and when u go to check out it'll add a promotion to ur order filling what ever the cost was until u use all 150$Here the pros and cons I've noticedPros -Amazing battery life lasted me from 4:45am to  9pm with 15% remaining.Google image search biuld in to the phone, I love itCamera is way better then the fold but given the fold doesn't really focus on camera qualityCons -Here's the big oof with this phone, I haven't read too much in to it or anything but as to what I'm aware, 32bit system is getting dropped and newer phones are gonna now only support 64bit operating systems so u might loose some of the apps you had previously ( I lost around 12 apps/games ) and that's not saying it won't be fixed later on the dev could add 64bit to the app.Other then that I have no other complaints about it.

name: Esmely
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
comment: La bateria al ser 4000 milianperios esta supuesto a no durar casi nada pero samsung hizo un trabajo increble con la optimizacion. Es un celular tan poderoso que no tiene ningun problema con jugar juegos exigentes. Las animaciones de este celular estan a otro nivel ya que muestra animaciones bonitas al escuchar musica y al abrir aplicaciones. El unico problema que tiene el celular son las camaras, no estan optimizadas ya que al procesar cualquier imagen con la camara de 50 megapixeles salen las imagen con mucha luz y se sienten algo quemadas. Lo que me dejo feliz fue la calidad de video ya que esta muy estabilizado y salen con buena calidad.

name: Yalal Besereni
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
comment: El Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra es un tel√©fono que ha generado gran expectaci√≥n.Dimensiones y Peso: El S24 Ultra mide 162,3 x 79 x 8,6 mm y pesa 233 g. Su pantalla de 6,8 pulgadas ofrece una resoluci√≥n Quad HD+ AMOLED LTPO con una tasa de refresco de 120 Hz y protecci√≥n Gorilla Glass Armor1.Almacenamiento: Viene en variantes de 12 + 256 GB, 12 + 512 GB y 12 + 1 TB.C√°maras Traseras:Principal: 200 MP, apertura f/1.7, con estabilizaci√≥n √≥ptica de imagen (OIS).Telefoto: 50 MP, apertura f/3.4, OIS, zoom √≥ptico 5x.Ultra gran angular: 10 MP, apertura f/2.4, OIS, zoom √≥ptico 3x.Macro: 12 MP, apertura f/2.2.C√°mara Frontal: 12 MP, apertura f/2.2.Bater√≠a: 5.000 mAh con carga r√°pida de 45 W y carga inal√°mbrica de 15 W.Sistema Operativo: Basado en Android 14 con One UI 6.1.Conectividad: 5G, WiFi 7, Bluetooth 5.3, GPS, NFC, UWB, USB tipo C.Otros: Certificaci√≥n IP68, S-Pen integrado, Samsung Dex.En resumen, el Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra es un s√≥lido candidato a ser uno de los mejores tel√©fonos Android del a√±o. Su potente hardware, pantalla n√≠tida y funciones inteligentes lo hacen destacar. Sin embargo, ten en cuenta que su precio es elevado

name: Gene
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
comment: Phone is great so far.  My issue is with Amazon customer service.  I never received the $150 e-gift card.  I contacted customer service and they act like they have no idea what I am talking about even though I sent them a screenshot of the order showing it was redeemed.UPDATE:  As someone else mentioned, you have to purchase something that is shipped and sold from Amazon.  Pretty limiting.  I wanted to purchase a new charger -  Samsung, Anker, Ugreen all ship from their own stores.  Also, it shows as a discount rather than a Gift Card.

name: Amazon Customer
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
comment: I bought the phone in January 2024,with a Pre-Order Amazon promotion credit $150. The phone has been good as expected. I received an email said "Your order has earned you a promotional credit which we have added to your account." This never happened. I feel the "Promotion" is a scam.

name: Vanessa Reale
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
comment: I don‚Äôt typically buy electronics off of Amazon and normally order straight from the manufacturer or Best Buy. I tried pre ordering from Samsung and had SO many issues. They canceled my order the day it was supposed to ship and then kept canceling it after replacing the order and trying to speak to customer service. I had the same experience with Best Buy. Order was constantly being canceled and not a single person over the phone or in the store could answer. Both Samsung and Best Buy stated that we wouldn‚Äôt get the product until the end of March. When ordering from Amazon, we had zero issues and got the product two days after purchasing it.

name: BR Reviewer
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
comment: So far I'm not impressed. It's very hard to differentiate from an iPhone until you turn it on. Maybe that's the point.Good:Fingerprint scanner is VERY fast compared to my older s10. S10 is 5 years older so that isn't saying much.Lame:No more rounded edges or screen. SD card was great to be able to add more space when you download movies from apps.  No Headphone port, which has come in handy on OLD devices that only support aux inputs.The AI features are neat, but not all that useful. Maybe if you need to translate languages often. I'm not sure why the AI stuff can't be applied to any other phone, since a lot of it is offloaded to the cloud anyway.Seems to be an S23 with some software that could also work on the s23.  Feels like a step backward from an older S10, which had curved edges, headphone and SD card ports. Phones seem to have plateaued about 4 years ago.Save your money and get an older s23 or 22.

name: Red Pin
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
comment: I did a ton of research before I committed to a purchase.  But it's not the same kind of research that techies can do.  I rely on their input for my impressions and then I ogle the colors and how it fits in my hand and how fast it goes and can I type better on the shrunken keyboard -- all while trusting the professional reviewers.  I'm writing this review for people like me.  Do your own research and trust in that.  I think I got a terrific phone that looks phenomenal and will last me for at least 7 more years.  And using it is so easy.  Transferring everything was so easy.  Now I'll have to master the camera.  Nitpicky opinions are no longer useful.  "It should have square corners, it should have round corners, they did this, why didn't they do that..." ENOUGH.  Thank you, Samsung, I'm happy to be a member of your club and this phone is amazing to me.

name: Amazon Customer
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
comment: Prior to buying the s24+ I purchased a Pixel 8 Pro and really wanted to love it. That however turned into pure frustration with multiple glitches in the first two weeks of ownership that Google support couldn't fix. So much so, that the Pixel 8 Pro was returned in favor of the s24+. I am so glad I did that, because owning the s24+ has been nothing but pure joy. I mean this phone rocks in every way and the transition from my old s10 5g was seamless and straightforward. It literally took couple of hours from start to finish and there is no learning curve. With the Pixel 8 Pro transferring data was a complete disaster with multiple glitches, unfixable bugs and a few calls to Google support. There were some many issues with the Pixel 8 Pro that it would take an essay to list them all. Thank you Samsung for turning my frustration into pure joy!

name: Ken
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
comment: $200 Amazon finally received.  Glad had missed return pick up. Purchased special color from Samsung (in used) and gray from Amazon (not opened yet, waiting for case). Nice display and great battery life. Screen reflective rate decreased 75% is true w/o screen protector or used non-reflective screen protector. Used to charge S24 2 to 3 times when battery @ 50% or less before bed time. Now only 1 time with s24 ultra. Cameras are much better than s24. Got used to the weight after a week

name: Eugenio S.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
comment: Cada d√≠a me gusta m√°s, he disfrutado descubriendo muchas de sus funciones, a√∫n me quedan aspectos por probar, verdaderamente es un salto hacia el futuro, comprar este tel√©fono de 512 GB es tener una de las mejores opciones en comunicaciones,  entretenimiento, la tecnolog√≠a de inteligencia artificial ha puesto en el n√∫mero 1 a todos aquellos que nos hemos mantenido en Android. Compr√© un Samsung S24 Ultra y disfrute de lo que nadie ha podido hacer anteriormente con un tel√©fono.

name: Pablo Guerra
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
comment: Primera me tomo el tiempo para escribir una opini√≥n pero tengo que hacerlo. Excelente dispositivo en todos los aspectos. Camara, rendimiento, sonido y estilo. Llevo 4 dias us√°ndolo y ha sido una grata experiencia. Las novedades de la IA hacen un gran atractivo al dia dia. Tenia antes s21 fe y pensaba cambiarme a Iphone pero le quize dar un chance al ultra y espectacular. Sigan haciendo telefonos asi! Eso si es un telefono rubusto y para algunos gustos algo pesado. Para mi perfecto. Gracias.

name: S.C
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
comment: I am an iPhone user, and I wanted a second phone to be used as my work phone. I was surprised at how light the S 24+ is. I‚Äôm using an android phone after almost 10 years. It is really refreshing. I like the AI features a lot especially useful on WhatsApp. The translations are pretty good.

name: Noel
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
comment: I live in a fringe area. Above all else in a phone, I need excellent signal handling. If it won't talk to the cell tower, everything else is worthless.  The S24 Ultra fails in this one thing.  I experienced dropped calls, and extremely poor data rates.  My kids have a Galaxy A02 and a TCL 40: both low-end budget phones.  Yet both of these phones consistently have 6db higher signal levels, and twice the download bandwidth of this "flagship" phone.  I'm sure if you live in an area with excellent signal, this will be an excellent phone for you.  But if you struggle with a cell signal, this is not the phone for you.

name: Gabe Cline
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
comment: I got the phone went to my reg carrier and spent money to get a card and kit spent 2 hours before I was told it wouldn't work on their site-I then try ed a few other well known carries that said t hey could help me with activation of a esim card.So I aske Amazon since it was a completely unlocked phone if they could help me get a few dollars back-its costing me15 more dollars per month because I cant use my reg carrier.They said they couldn't get a differment of the price i paid-its its not unlocked to all carriers then the phone shouldn't be as expensive as a totally unlocked one.Iam not a Happy customer.

name: Pasquale
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
comment: The cell phone is nice, fast and secure.I'm very happy with my purchase.YA HE HABLADO CON VARIAS PERSONAS DE SERVICIO A CLIENTE Y NO ME QUIEREN DAR LOS $200 D√ìLARES DE CR√âDITO. HABL√â CON EL SUPERVISOR ADAN EL LUNES 12 DE FEBRERO Y ME DIJO QUE ME IBA A AYUDAR, PERO HASTA HORA NO ME APERECE EL CR√âDITO PROMETIDO.

name: M
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
comment: edit: after using for about a week... phone still doesn't push gmail notifications after being idle for 20+ minutes.  Seems like android or samsungs being too aggressive in making apps sleep in order to increase the Batter Life statistics for reviewers or something.  Seems to be happening on all my android devices... so not sure if it's an Android 14 issue ('feature') or just the company trying to make their battery life seem better than it is bc they're forcing apps to not be able to push notification.  I only get notification pop-ups after I unlock the phone.... which is almost useless.---finally the human race has come to the conclusion that curved edge displays are absolutely not it.  thank you. thank you. thank you.  The phone physically looks fantastic.  Feels great.. flat display, finally.  Speakers sound good.  Spen color doesn't match... no idea why they can't figure that one out.  Seems like an easy thing to do.  Still doesn't have secure face unlock... iphone does it.  Pixel does it...the thing is, i am barely able to use this phone because it didn't come with a charger.  this phone msrp $1,419.99 and the company doesn't include a charging adapter? $1,419.99.Also, so many features/customization options have been removed.. only mentioning a few out of the dozens, but the color settings don't allow for a vivid option that works.  The display is grainy.  There are color banding issues.  you can't change the brightness level of the AoD.  Bixby can't 'dismiss' a timer that has gone off (apple can do this)... so you have to physically press "dismiss" instead of saying "bixby, dismiss timer."  again, i am mentioning a few out of DOZENS.

name: Cheryl
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
comment: Yes, I used an S8 (new Oct. 2018) and it worked great - no problems except 64G space and has not been supported by Samsung for a while. I bought an unlocked Samsung Galaxy S24+ and it is great so far. Fast response, camera zoom is very nice, many features I don't need but will have fun playing with.

name: Steven
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
comment: Upgraded to an S24 Ultra from an S21.  Worth it.You definitely feel this phone in your pocket. Its big.Get a case, you definitely don't want t drop this thing.

name: ResearchGoddess
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
comment: This was supposed to be an upgrade from my S10e.  However, the sound quality is very disappointing.  Even at full volume, music playing from this phone is not nearly as loud as my old phone.  I see from the Samsung website that others have the same complaint.  I've shared this with Samsung.  Hopefully it's something that can be addressed with a software patch and not a hardware issue.  If anything changes in this regard, I'll update my review.Update: got an unhelpful response from Samsung yesterday.  Today, I tried listening to music through earbuds instead of using the phone speakers.  The left channel is almost completely muted.  I checked the equalizer and it's set for even distribution between left and right channels.  I've let Samsung know about this.  We'll see what happens.Update 2: Samsung tells me they've raised the issue w/their developers for further evaluation.  Meanwhile, I've noticed a second issue.  The screen flickers when I scroll with my finger.  This happens with all the applications on my phone. I've reported this to Samsung as well.Update 3: I've discovered the problem with the left channel.  The problem wasn't in the Equalizer.  In Settings > Accessibility > Hearing enhancements, the balance was incorrect.  I've corrected that, and now the sound is great with my earbuds. However, the loudness and sound quality through the phone speakers still are inferior to my S10e.

name: Mariela Grigorova
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
comment: First and foremost that yellow color is absolutely stunning, the photos don't do any justice. It's very subtle, almost beige with gold trim on the sides. Very much needed upgrade from Note 9, this phone is an absolute beast.

name: PaulaB
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
comment: The phone is great. Samsung did it again.  However, I only bought this straight out from Amazon because they promised a $200 reward which made this a cheaper option than my carrier.  Well, they have not given me the credit and each time I call I am told to just wait.  It's been 14 days.  Again, the phone is great.  Buy from your carrier.  I learned my lesson here.

name: Brandon Montoya
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
comment: This phone is amazing video recording is sooooo crisp. Samsung UI is smooth...... also this phone design compliments a simple but sophisticated style...... the only thing that bums me out is when I pre-ordered I never received my redeemed 200 gift card

name: Alexis
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
comment: Para m√≠, el mejor tel√©fono que ha hecho Samsung. Estoy s√∫per contento con √©l, lo fluido que est√°. Para m√≠, fue un gran cambio. ¬°Es una maravilla!

name: Lana Ivette
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
comment: The Vivid and Standard colors are the same, they do not change. The keyboard isn't great, you have to push down hard on keys. I'm not impressed with this phone. It's a bit Glitchy. The voice doesn't understand you very well when talking. If Samsung doesn't give an update soon to fix these problems; I'm going to return it, before the windows closes on the return.

name: Kevin
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
comment: I, like many others, are in complete shock of how BAD, DULL and WASHED OUT the screen colors are on this phone. Surely these are defective, I can't think of any other reason. This simply can NOT be on purpose like they claim. Along with that, a lot of games I've played have a very slight 'stutter' or lag every other few minutes. I am furious I spent all of this money on phone with subpar screen colors, I mean that has to be in the top 3 aspects of a phone, marked at this price, that NEEDS to be perfect, no exception.I don't know if my phone is defective, but I'm not at all satisfied. If Samsung does not fix this egregious issue, I will have no choice but to return in. That's the last thing I want to do, it's a gorgeous phone otherwise but the color and lag issues are seriously insane for a phone that costs this much.SAMSUNG - You NEED to fix the color issue, save your reputation. I will have no other choice but to NEVER buy your phones again after this.

name: D Clement
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
comment: 02-12-24 NEW UPDATE.  Samsung customer service now says a fix IS coming however this was verbal from a REP, nothing official like what Samsung Spain had put out. At this point, I don;t know what to think. IF IF IF a fix is coming, then the phone will be GREAT. If no fix is provided, this will go down in Samsung history as one of their worst screwups ever and it WILL cost them a lot of loyal customers. i am REALLY on the fence about sending these back (We purchased two of them) UPDATE 02-05-23- "Samsung Spain" released a statement on 02-04-2024 saying Samsung has NO INTENTION of fixing the screen color problem, the dull non vivid screen colors are BY DESIGN.. The VIVID color is basically disconnected. This screen is washed out. Colors are dull and screen does not pop. The My old S21FE has a screen 10x better than this new phone. Samsung says it is a glitch in the software however there is NO FIX as of now (Feb 4th). If no update or fix is provided in the next two weeks, I will return the phone. IF a fix is provided, I will update my review to 5 stars. The PURPLE color is really quite nice. It is darker than the photos and a very pleasing shade, not loud and obnoxious at all.

name: friezer
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
comment: Pre-ordered the S24 Ultra via AT&T to upgrade from a Samsung S20 FE.  The S24 Ultra is a behemoth in every sense of that word - features and weight.  My advice is to get it IF you have a reason to have the features unique to it.  Otherwise, there are lighter weight and smaller phones that are more comfortable to use daily -- and I say that as a male who is over 6'5", with hands that match my height. The Samsung S24 Plus comes to mind.I am keeping the S24 UItra because of my interest in photography (this phone has a macro feature, AF on its ultrawide lens, and greater telephoto abilities than the S24 Plus) and my use of the S Pen.  Photos are excellent, including at 5x zoom.  The screen brightness, resolution and anti-glare features are great.  The S Pen allows me to make precise choices on the screen for a variety of uses.  The battery easily lasts all day with moderate use.My only big knock is the weight of the phone.  Just too much.  Smaller issue -the sharp edges, but I am no longer really noticing it after two weeks.

name: JoHn
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
comment: Let me cut it short for you, if you already have the S23 ultra, or S22 Ultra, there is absolutely no reason for you to upgrade to this one, both phones are almost identical despite all the YouTube videos that want you to think otherwise!The AI gimmick that's all over the internet isn't really integrated into everyday use as expected either so that was not a plus point.The battery quickly learned my patterns and got better after a few days of use,but still not enough for a full day.The processor is amazing and everything runs so smoothly all day long, from productivity apps to games, with its amazing screen, everything just looks better on this phone. The colors do seem a bit washed out on this screen vs the S23 ultra, but Samsung is saying there will be a fix for this.The only disappointment, and the reason why I won't keep that phone, are the cameras.The selfie camera is a disappointment both indoor and, surprisingly, even outdoor it was not good.I had a family event and was too excited to use that big Main camera for all the shots, but I was left disappointed with the performance compared to the iPhone. The low light pictures were not good at all, while pictures with enough light were good, but nothing special. I can't even start to compare this camera to the Google Pixel lines, not even close!Bottom line, you'll get a great daily performance with a good camera and beautiful screen, but I would wait until the price goes down a bit.

name: Raul
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
comment: I like the cell phone, what I don't like are the colors of the screen, especially in vivid colors, compared to my S21 plus, my S21 plus has much better tones, I hope they can solve it with the first update they have, the photos are the same The ones on my S21 plus make me much better

name: NutnSpcl
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
comment: If you own an older model of this phone, like the S21, do not buy ithe S24.  IMO, it is too small.  Buy the S24+ instead.  You will be glad you did.

name: Mark Brown
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
comment: The Galaxy S23 Plus was a phone I really liked, but I wasn‚Äôt sure who to recommend it to. The Galaxy S24 Plus is another great smartphone from Samsung, and this time around, it makes a lot more sense.If you‚Äôre in the market for a big Samsung phone, the S24 Plus would be my personal recommendation over the S24 Ultra. The hardware is top-tier, the screen is almost every bit as good, the performance is great, the battery life is outstanding, and ‚Äî if you care about them ‚Äî you get all of the same Galaxy AI features. The only differences between the S24 Plus and the S24 Ultra are the improved camera system and the S Pen. But is that really worth an extra $300? I certainly don‚Äôt think so. The Galaxy S24 Ultra is a fantastic smartphone and one of the best you can buy in 2024. But it‚Äôs also $1,300.  There‚Äôs also the OnePlus 12 to consider, which delivers similarly great performance and battery life for $800. It‚Äôs a great package, but you also have to deal with a curved screen, a lower IP rating, no AI tricks, and fewer software updates. The regular Galaxy S24 shares many of the S24 Plus‚Äô great qualities for the same $800 price, but you‚Äôll need to put up with a smaller screen, lesser battery life, and slower charging.You have a lot of options to consider against the Galaxy S24 Plus, as is the case when you‚Äôre looking to buy any smartphone. But each alternative to the S24 Plus also has its own share of compromises. If the Galaxy S24 Plus‚Äô strong suits line up with what you prioritize in a phone ‚Äî hardware, display, performance, and battery life ‚Äî I can‚Äôt recommend it enough.

name: Audisarefun
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
comment: Overall the s24 ultra 5G is the best phone I have ever owned, I bought 2 phones the purple color and the gold color, the purple one is not a cristal color or metalic purple but it looks purple.  The gold color looks amazing,  it looks like real gold. As far as battery life it meets and exceeds my expectations I can go all day and about the time I go to bed usually around 9 pm I can still have a 40 percent of battery life remaining.The screen looks brighter on sunny days with is an improvement compared to my s21 ultra 5G.The speakers sound awesome,  very clear and loud.The antenna or antennas on the s24 ultra we're also improved,  I can get a better reception and better download speeds, the phone transitions very smooth between 5g and 4g lte when 5 g is not strong enough or when there is no 5g connectivity.Let's not forget about the s pen, it is a multifunction pen, to be used to take pictures with it and by the way they look beautiful with some improvements on the camera. The s pen has a few other features that can be used to do a power point presentation and a few more things we can do with the s pen.I do understand that for 1400 dollars phone it should come with a complete charger and not just the charging cable.I do suspect that Samsung along with other manufacturers were limited to reduce the plastic usage and that could be the reason they did not include a brick charger. Assuming that previous galaxy fans would already have a brick charger.But I would of like to get a brick along with tye cable for that price. Unfortunately that was not the case.Luckily if you pre order your phone you could of got some goodies from Samsung like brick charger or cases or galaxy buds for free and or some smart watches/ galaxy buds/ tablet with a 150 dolar discount (credit)

name: Tobey64
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
comment: An amazing phone but is over priced. I'm not sure and can't speak for all the negative reviews on this phone with the washed out screen because mine is bright and beautiful like all my Samsung phones have always been. The battery is incredible. I can get a day and a half of heavy use and 2 days light to moderate without turning on battery saver but of course there are task that IMO are a battery killer like Android Auto when I'm navigating and streaming music at the same time but that's going would be the case with any battery because Android auto runs a lot of apps in the background. This phone is ridiculously fast, never had a phone quite this fast even my S23 Ultra wasn't this fast. My only complaint because I didn't pre order and spent over 1500 dollars after tax and that's just crazy when you think about what that can get you with an actual computer that isn't out dated the moment you purchase. But yeah still I am very pleased with my new beast even though only had it for a couple of weeks so far. If you have the funds and your not like me and buy 6 phones a year I think you'll get more than your moneys worth cause Samsung's just last and last for many years. My wife had her S9+ for over 5 years and the one before that for 4 years and everything worked fine on them. Highly recommend this phone.

name: Kyle S
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
comment: Being a Samsung user for many years this is the worst series of Samsung phones I have ever seen. I bought the s24 ultra and the screen is super grainy Samsung refuses to do anything about it and it just straight up looks like crap. The screen is so dull and ugly looking nothing like older Samsungs in any way. It feels like a cheap $300 or less phone probably worse. And the camera is one of the worst I‚Äôve seen from Samsung pictures are over processed and blurry and just straight up looks terrible. I don‚Äôt usually write reviews but after this experience, I have to prevent other people from falling into the same trap. If you have an older Samsung, just keep that you‚Äôll be much better off and have a much better phone with a bunch of money in your pocket. This so-called flagship phone is nothing but a cheaply made phone with no quality control with a company that doesn‚Äôt stand behind anything they make all they‚Äôre worried about is their pockets.

name: Alex
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
comment: Preamble: I currently own a Note 4, S4, S7, S8 and S20U. IMO, the S7 was the best camera for getting everything in focus with sharp details and excellent color fidelity and 4K videos are terrific. The S8 suffered from some weird video wobbles. The Note 4 was good in general, but the S7 really took the performance crown. Then came the S20U. Gorgeous display and had a SD Card slot. However, the camera was absolute and still is terrible. Can't focus on anything properly and wide shots were all bent at the edges.S24U Review starts now (I got mine early from t-mobile with build ending in: AWM9)Pros1. Flat Screen is absolutely perfect, no more rounded dust collecting edges and easier to apply tempered glass.2. Camera is superior compared to the S20U (well, any camera is...) and trades blows with the S7 and S8 and the macro camera on S24 helps with getting everything in focus and not just having the horrible higher DOF where most things are blurred out, so basically, you don't have to dance around to get everything in focus.3. It's fast.4. Still allows a nano sim card.5. Modes, I love this app, allows you to customize profiles for the phone based on your criteria and set it to run at a given time, like setting wallpaper, wifi on or off, screen color and blue light filter and so much more.Cons:1. Super AMOLED screen has been crippled to 85% DCI-P3. Looks like a cheap LCD screen. Vivid/Natural modes do nothing. Blue light filter makes it worse. Whites look bluish. It's like having a Ferrari and the manufacturer puts on governor on it because it goes to fast. It's a super amoled screen, give users the option of washed out, natural, vivid and ultra vivid, not just washed out.Don't take my word for it, go to your local carrier store and bring in your current Galaxy phone or just compare it to other phones in the store, it's that bad. If you have the S23U, it's not really an upgrade, it's more like a refresh that offers a flat display, but almost everything else is the same except for the washed out display and 10x optical dropped to 5x optical but with a higher resolution sensor.2. Camera doesn't take accurate colors, auto white balance doesn't work properly on macro shots.2. No charger (only a charging cable.)3. No SD Card slot.Notes:1. Forget about AI, between privacy and the fact they will be charging you for it at the end 2025, it's not worth. They are basically trying to get you hooked on it for a couple of years and then starting charging you for it once you rely on it. According to the Samsung product page: "Galaxy AI features by Samsung will be provided for free until the end of 2025 on supported Samsung Galaxy devices."2. 7 years of updates. Does that mean they allow you to change the battery during year 3 or 4? Of course not, and there's no battery service they offered either to make it last that long. It's a gimmick. Just like 10 year warranties on washing machines for the motor only, while everything breaks down before 10 years.3. I can't say if there's any detriment with the new AR glass, because the color saturation is so poor. If that's fixed, I'll update this review appropriately.4. I find my S20U gets brighter then the claimed max 2600 nits of this phone.Bottom line, I'm returning mine if Samsung doesn't fix the washed out display and the color issue on the camera. If they can fix that, it's a great phone, just don't get hooked on the AI unless you're willing to pay for it in the future."The Dynamic AMOLED 2X display on Galaxy S24 Ultra received a certification from VDE Germany for 100 percent Mobile Color Volume in the DCI-P3 color range, which means your images aren‚Äôt washed out and you‚Äôll get unbelievably vivid colors regardless of differing levels of brightness. The display can achieve peak brightness of up to 2600 nits, improving the contrast between dark and light aspects of digital content for a more brilliant picture quality, with a 5,000,000:1 contrast ratio to make your mobile experience more immersive. ""

comment: I love this phone.  No issues at all.  The fact that there are still some people complaining about no external memory card that has not been in a galaxy for years goes to show how valid some of the negative remarks are

date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
comment: This phone is hands down the best smartphone thus far. It has the best of everything you need and more. The S24 Ultra is a BEAST!!
